metadata.dc:author: Llamazares Cachá, G
Molino Trinidad, C
Montañá Figuls, X
Alvarez Moro, F J
metadata.dc:description: The authors present a case of myeloproliferative syndrome with an exceptional clinical picture of pain in the right hypochondrium and right iliac fossa, with no mictional syndrome or hematuria, caused by the appearance of a spontaneous subcapsular hematoma. They discuss the frequency of the different kinds of kidney hematomas and their causes. They also describe the typical radiological signs of the subcapsular hematoma in comparison with the other forms of kidney hematomas.
metadata.dc:title: Hematoma renal subcapsular: presentación de un caso de etiología inusual.
[Subcapsular renal hematoma: report of a case of unusual etiology].
